alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Washington (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 12:25AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Fayette and Washington. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1221 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a prolonged period of moderate to heavy rain across portions of central Washington county into northern Fayette county. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Washington, Connellsville, California, Wolfdale, Bentleyville, East Washington, South Connellsville, Perryopolis, Speers, Ellsworth, Roscoe, Eighty Four, Cokeburg, Fayette City, Newell, Allenport, Stockdale, Vanderbilt, Beallsville and Long Branch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
